verses.kjv: And Hiram king of Tyre sent his servants unto Solomon; for he had heard that they had anointed him king in the room of his father: for Hiram was ever a lover of David.
verses.web: Hiram king of Tyre sent his servants to Solomon; for he had heard that they had anointed him king in the place of his father, and Hiram had always loved David.
verses.ct: King Hiram of Tyre sent his officials to Solomon when he heard that Solomon had been anointed king in place of his father David. Hiram had always been a close ally and friend of David.

verses.kjv: And Solomon sent to Hiram, saying,
verses.ct: Solomon sent a message back to Hiram, saying,

verses.kjv: Thou knowest how that David my father could not build an house unto the name of the LORD his God for the wars which were about him on every side, until the LORD put them under the soles of his feet.
verses.web: “You know that David my father could not build a house for the name of LORD his God because of the wars which were around him on every side, until LORD put his enemies under the soles of his feet.
verses.ct: "You know that my father David was never able to build a temple for the name of the LORD his God. He was surrounded by wars on every side until the LORD finally crushed his enemies beneath his feet.

verses.kjv: But now the LORD my God hath given me rest on every side, so that there is neither adversary nor evil occurrent.
verses.web: But now LORD my God has given me rest on every side. There is no enemy and no evil occurrence.
verses.ct: But now the LORD my God has given me peace on every side. There is no enemy threatening me and no disaster to deal with.

verses.kjv: And, behold, I purpose to build an house unto the name of the LORD my God, as the LORD spake unto David my father, saying, Thy son, whom I will set upon thy throne in thy room, he shall build an house unto my name.
verses.web: Behold, I intend to build a house for the name of LORD my God, as LORD spoke to David my father, saying, ‘Your son, whom I will set on your throne in your place shall build the house for my name.’
verses.ct: So I intend to build a temple for the name of the LORD my God, just as the LORD told my father David: 'Your son, whom I will place on your throne after you, will be the one to build a temple for my name.'

verses.kjv: Now therefore command thou that they hew me cedar trees out of Lebanon; and my servants shall be with thy servants: and unto thee will I give hire for thy servants according to all that thou shalt appoint: for thou knowest that there is not among us any that can skill to hew timber like unto the Sidonians.
verses.web: Now therefore command that cedar trees be cut for me out of Lebanon. My servants will be with your servants; and I will give you wages for your servants according to all that you say. For you know that there is nobody among us who knows how to cut timber like the Sidonians.”
verses.ct: So please order your workers to cut cedar trees for me from Lebanon. My workers will serve alongside yours, and I'll pay your workers whatever wages you set. You know as well as I do that nobody can cut timber like the Sidonians."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Hiram heard the words of Solomon, that he rejoiced greatly, and said, Blessed be the LORD this day, which hath given unto David a wise son over this great people.
verses.web: When Hiram heard the words of Solomon, he rejoiced greatly, and said, “Blessed is LORD today, who has given to David a wise son to rule over this great people.”
verses.ct: When Hiram heard Solomon's message, he was overjoyed and said, "Praise the LORD today, for he has given David a wise son to rule over this great nation."

verses.kjv: And Hiram sent to Solomon, saying, I have considered the things which thou sentest to me for: and I will do all thy desire concerning timber of cedar, and concerning timber of fir.
verses.web: Hiram sent to Solomon, saying, “I have heard the message which you have sent to me. I will do all your desire concerning timber of cedar, and concerning cypress timber.
verses.ct: Hiram sent his reply to Solomon: "I've received your message and I'm ready to do everything you've asked. I'll supply all the cedar and cypress timber you need.

verses.kjv: My servants shall bring them down from Lebanon unto the sea: and I will convey them by sea in floats unto the place that thou shalt appoint me, and will cause them to be discharged there, and thou shalt receive them: and thou shalt accomplish my desire, in giving food for my household.
verses.web: My servants will bring them down from Lebanon to the sea. I will make them into rafts to go by sea to the place that you specify to me, and will cause them to be broken up there, and you will receive them. You will accomplish my desire, in giving food for my household.”
verses.ct: My workers will bring the logs down from Lebanon to the coast. I'll have them tied together into rafts and floated by sea to whatever location you choose. Once they arrive, I'll have them broken apart so you can collect them. In return, you'll supply food for my household."

verses.kjv: So Hiram gave Solomon cedar trees and fir trees according to all his desire.
verses.web: So Hiram gave Solomon cedar timber and cypress timber according to all his desire.
verses.ct: So Hiram provided Solomon with all the cedar and cypress timber he wanted.

verses.kjv: And Solomon gave Hiram twenty thousand measures of wheat for food to his household, and twenty measures of pure oil: thus gave Solomon to Hiram year by year.
verses.web: Solomon gave Hiram twenty thousand cors of wheat for food to his household, and twenty cors of pure oil. Solomon gave this to Hiram year by year.
verses.ct: In return, Solomon gave Hiram 20,000 cors of wheat and 20 cors of pure olive oil as food for his household. Solomon sent this payment every year.

verses.kjv: And the LORD gave Solomon wisdom, as he promised him: and there was peace between Hiram and Solomon; and they two made a league together.
verses.web: LORD gave Solomon wisdom, as he promised him. There was peace between Hiram and Solomon, and the two of them made a treaty together.
verses.ct: The LORD gave Solomon wisdom, just as he had promised. There was peace between Hiram and Solomon, and the two of them made a formal treaty.

verses.kjv: And king Solomon raised a levy out of all Israel; and the levy was thirty thousand men.
verses.web: King Solomon raised a levy out of all Israel; and the levy was thirty thousand men.
verses.ct: King Solomon drafted forced laborers from all across Israel — 30,000 men in total.

verses.kjv: And he sent them to Lebanon, ten thousand a month by courses: a month they were in Lebanon, and two months at home: and Adoniram was over the levy.
verses.web: He sent them to Lebanon, ten thousand a month by courses; for a month they were in Lebanon, and two months at home; and Adoniram was over the men subject to forced labor.
verses.ct: He sent them to Lebanon in rotating shifts of 10,000 per month. They would work one month in Lebanon and then spend two months at home. Adoniram was in charge of the entire labor force.

verses.kjv: And Solomon had threescore and ten thousand that bare burdens, and fourscore thousand hewers in the mountains;
verses.web: Solomon had seventy thousand who bore burdens, and eighty thousand who were stone cutters in the mountains;
verses.ct: Solomon also had 70,000 men carrying loads and 80,000 men cutting stone in the hill country.

verses.kjv: Beside the chief of Solomon’s officers which were over the work, three thousand and three hundred, which ruled over the people that wrought in the work.
verses.web: besides Solomon’s chief officers who were over the work, three thousand and three hundred, who ruled over the people who labored in the work.
verses.ct: On top of that, Solomon had 3,300 chief officers supervising the workers and managing the labor.

verses.kjv: And the king commanded, and they brought great stones, costly stones, and hewed stones, to lay the foundation of the house.
verses.web: The king commanded, and they cut out large stones, costly stones, to lay the foundation of the house with worked stone.
verses.ct: The king ordered his workers to quarry large, expensive stones and cut them precisely to lay the foundation of the temple.

verses.kjv: And Solomon’s builders and Hiram’s builders did hew them, and the stonesquarers: so they prepared timber and stones to build the house.
verses.web: Solomon’s builders and Hiram’s builders and the Gebalites cut them, and prepared the timber and the stones to build the house.
verses.ct: Solomon's builders, Hiram's builders, and the craftsmen from Gebal shaped the stones and prepared both the timber and the stonework for building the temple.
